intro: Diphyes bisepala, commonly known as the two-leaved two-lobed plant, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves that are typically divided into two distinct lobes. Its flowers are usually small and greenish-white, with a subtle fragrance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Diphyes bisepala is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
